VA Pension as an Accrued Benefit
Do not count VA pension that is paid as an accrued benefit.
In
Martin v. Brown
, 7 Vet.App. 196 (1994), the Court of Appeals for Veterans ClaimsÂ held that when pension benefits are paid as an accrued benefit, that payment meets the pension-income-exclusion provision of
38 U.S.C. 1503(a)(2)
, and, therefore, is not IVAP.
